Title.evidence: Tibial Bone Remodeling with Total Knee Arthroplasty: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: randomised to receive either rotating-platform (n=28) or fixed-platform (n=26) cemented TKA

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either rotating-platform (n=28) or fixed-platform (n=26) cemented TKA

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare tibial bone density changes in cemented TKA components with different bearing designs.

Method_Outcome.evidence: CT scans were performed postoperatively and at 1 and 2 years.

Number_Randomised.evidence: randomised to receive either rotating-platform (n=28) or fixed-platform (n=26) cemented TKA

Result_Outcome.evidence: Cancellous bone density loss was observed in all proximal tibial regions in both cohorts, with a maximum loss of 12.6% at 2 years.
